translations.english_saheeh: By the star when it descends,
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. By the star when it goes down (or vanishes).
translations.english_rwwad: By the star when it sets,

phonetic: 53.2 Mā Đalla Şāĥibukum Wa Mā Ghawá

translations.english_saheeh: Your companion [i.e., Muḥammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Your companion (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has neither gone astray nor has erred.
translations.english_rwwad: Your companion [the Prophet] has neither strayed nor is he deluded.

translations.english_saheeh: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nor does he speak of (his own) desire.
translations.english_rwwad: Nor does he speak out of his own desire.

translations.english_saheeh: It is not but a revelation revealed,
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is only a Revelation revealed.
translations.english_rwwad: It is but a revelation sent down [to him].

translations.english_saheeh: Taught to him by one intense in strength [i.e., Gabriel] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: He has been taught (this Qur’ân) by one mighty in power [Jibrîl (Gabriel)]
translations.english_rwwad: He was taught by [an angel of] mighty power,

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[1562]- i.e., strength of body and of mind.
[1563]- Gabriel appeared to Muḥammad (ﷺ) at the outset of his prophethood in the angelic form in which Allāh originally created him.

translations.english_saheeh: One of soundness.[1562] And he rose to [his] true form[1563]
translations.english_hilali_khan: One free from any defect in body and mind then he (Jibrîl - Gabriel in his real shape as created by Allah) rose and became stable.
translations.english_rwwad: and of great perfection, who manifested himself [in his true form]

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1564]- i.e., in the sky, above the eastern horizon.

translations.english_saheeh: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.[1564]
translations.english_hilali_khan: While he [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] was in the highest part of the horizon, (Tafsir Ibn Kathir)
translations.english_rwwad: when he was on the higher horizon.

translations.english_saheeh: Then he approached and descended
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] approached and came closer,
translations.english_rwwad: Then he approached [the Prophet] and descended,

translations.english_saheeh: And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And was at a distance of two bows’ length or (even) nearer.
translations.english_rwwad: until he was only two bow-lengths away or even closer.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1565]- i.e., to the Servant of Allāh, Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

translations.english_saheeh: And he revealed to His Servant[1565] what he revealed [i.e., conveyed].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So (Allâh) revealed to His slave [Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم through Jibrîl (Gabriel) عليه السلام] whatever He revealed.
translations.english_rwwad: Then he revealed to His slave what he had to reveal.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1566]- i.e., mind or perception (of the Prophet [ﷺ]).

translations.english_saheeh: The heart[1566] did not lie [about] what it saw.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The (Prophet’s) heart lied not in what he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw.
translations.english_rwwad: The [Prophet’s] heart did not deny what he saw.

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.53:12) Al-Mi‘râj (i.e. Ascent of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم to the heavens with his body and soul (بالروح والجسد).
Narrated Mâlik bin Sa‘sa‘ah رضي الله عنه: The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم said, "While I was at the house in a state midway between sleep and wakefulness, (an angel recognized me) as the man lying between two men. A golden tray full of wisdom and belief was brought to me and my body was cut open from the throat to the lower part of the abdomen and then my abdomen was washed with Zamzam water and (my heart was) filled with wisdom and belief. Al-Burâq, a white animal smaller than a mule and bigger than a donkey was brought to me and I set out with Jibrîl (Gabriel). When I reached the nearest heaven, Jibrîl said to the gate-keeper of the heaven, ‘Open the gate.’ The gate-keeper asked, ‘Who is it?’ He said, ‘Jibrîl.’ The gate-keeper, said ‘Who is accompanying you?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. The gate-keeper said, ‘Has he been called?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Yes’. Then it was said, ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is!’ Then I met Adam and greeted him and he said, ‘You are welcome O son and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the second heaven. It was asked, ‘Who is it?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Jibrîl.’ It was said, ‘Who is with you?’ He said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. It was asked, ‘Has he been sent for?’ He said, ‘Yes.’ It was said, ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is.’ Then I met ‘Îsâ (Jesus) and Yahyâ (John) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the third heaven. It was asked, ‘Who is it?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Jibrîl.’ It was asked, ‘Who is with you?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم’. It was asked, ‘Has he been sent for?’ Jibrîl said, ‘Yes.’ It was said ‘He is welcome. What a wonderful visit his is!’ (The Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم added:). There I met Yûsuf (Joseph) and greeted him, and he replied, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet!’ Then we ascended to the fourth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met Idrîs (Enoch) and greeted him. He said, ‘You are welcome O brother and Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the fifth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Hârûn (Aaron) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ Then we ascended to the sixth heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Mûsâ (Moses) who said, ‘You are welcome, O brother and a Prophet.’ When I proceeded on, he started weeping and on being asked why he was weeping, he said, ‘O Lord! followers of this youth who was sent after me will enter Paradise in greater number than my followers.’ Then we ascended to the seventh heaven and again the same questions and answers were exchanged as in the previous heavens. There I met and greeted Abraham who said, ‘You are welcome, O son and a Prophet.’ Then I was shown Al-Bait Al-Ma‘mûr (i.e. Allah’s House). I asked Jibrîl about it and he said, ‘This is Al-Bait Al-Ma‘mûr where 70,000 angels perform prayers daily; and when they leave they never return to it (but always a fresh batch comes into it daily).’ Then I was shown Sidrat-ul Muntaha (i.e. the lote-tree of the utmost boundary over the seventh heaven) and I saw its Nabiq fruits which resembled the clay jugs of Hajar (a town in Arabia), and its leaves were like the ears of elephants, and four rivers originated at its root: two of them were apparent and two were hidden. I asked Jibrîl about those rivers and he said, ‘The two hidden rivers are in Paradise and the apparent ones are the Nile and the Euphrates.’ Then fifty prayers were enjoined on me. I descended till I met Mûsâ who asked me, ‘What have you done?’ I said, ‘Fifty prayers have been enjoined on me.’ He said, ‘I know the people better than you, because I had the hardest experience to bring Banî Israel to obedience. Your followers cannot put up with such obligation. So, return to your Lord and request Him (to reduce the number of prayers).’ I returned and requested Allah (for reduction) and He made it forty. I returned and [met Mûsâ] and had a similar discussion, and then returned again to Allah for reduction and He made it thirty, then twenty, then ten; and then I came to Mûsâ! who repeated the same advice. Ultimately Allah reduced it to five. When I came to Mûsâ again, he said, ‘What have you done?’ I said, ‘Allah has made it five only.’ He repeated the same advice but I said that I surrendered (to Allah’s Final Order)" Allah’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم was addressed by Allah, "I have decreed My Obligation and have reduced the burden on My slaves, and I shall reward a single good deed as if it were ten good deeds." (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol. 4, Hadîth No.429).

translations.english_saheeh: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Will you then dispute with him (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) about what he saw [during the Mi‘râj: (Ascent of the Prophet صلى الله عليه وسلم to the seven heavens)][1]
translations.english_rwwad: Do you dispute with him concerning what he saw?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1567]- i.e., on another occasion.  During his ascent into the heavens (al-Miʿrāj), the Prophet (ﷺ) also saw Gabriel in his true form.

translations.english_saheeh: And he certainly saw him in another descent[1567]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) saw him [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] at a second descent (i.e. another time).
translations.english_rwwad: He certainly saw him a second time

translations.english_saheeh: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Near Sidrat-ul-Muntaha (a lote-tree of the utmost boundary over the seventh heaven beyond which none can pass).
translations.english_rwwad: at the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary [in the seventh heaven]

translations.english_saheeh: Near it is the Garden of Refuge [i.e., Paradise] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Near it is the Paradise of Abode.
translations.english_rwwad: near which is the Garden of Abode,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1568]- Then and there he (ﷺ) saw Gabriel in angelic form.
footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.53:16) It is said that the Lot-Tree was covered with the light of Allah along with the angels and also with different kinds of colours. (Please see T. Ibn Kathîr).

translations.english_saheeh: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].[1568]
translations.english_hilali_khan: When that covered the lote-tree which did cover it![2]
translations.english_rwwad: when the Lote Tree was overwhelmed with [divine] splendors.

phonetic: 53.17 Mā Zāgha Al-Başaru Wa Mā Ţaghá

translations.english_saheeh: The sight [of the Prophet (ﷺ)] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].
translations.english_hilali_khan: The sight (of Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) turned not aside (right or left), nor it transgressed beyond the limit (ordained for it).
translations.english_rwwad: His gaze did not wander, nor did it look beyond the limit.

arabic_text: لَقَدۡ رَأَىٰ مِنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰٓ

translations.english_saheeh: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) did see of the Greatest Signs, of his Lord (Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: He certainly saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: So have you considered al-Lāt and al-ʿUzzā?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have you then considered Al-Lât, and Al-‘Uzzâ (two idols of the pagan Arabs)[3]
translations.english_rwwad: Have you [O disbelievers] thought about [the idols of] al-Lāt and al-‘Uzzā,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1569]- The three names given in this and the previous verse are those of well-known "goddesses" which were worshipped by the pagan Arabs before the spread of Islām.

translations.english_saheeh: And Manāt, the third - the other one?[1569]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Manât (another idol of the pagan Arabs), the other third?
translations.english_rwwad: and Manāt, the third one as well?

translations.english_saheeh: Is the male for you and for Him the female?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it for you the males and for Him the females?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you choose for yourselves males and for Him females?

translations.english_saheeh: That, then, is an unjust division.[1570]
translations.english_hilali_khan: That indeed is a division most unfair!
translations.english_rwwad: That is then an unfair division!

arabic_text: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّآ أَسۡمَآءٞ سَمَّيۡتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ
phonetic: 53.23 'In Hiya 'Illā 'Asmā'un Sammaytumūhā 'Antum Wa 'Ābā'uukum Mā 'Anzala Allāhu Bihā Min Sulţānin 'In Yattabi`ūna 'Illā Až-Žanna Wa Mā Tahwá Al-'Anfusu Wa Laqad Jā'ahum Min Rabbihimu Al-Hudá

translations.english_saheeh: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allāh has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They are but names which you have named - you and your fathers - for which Allâh has sent down no authority. They follow but a guess and that which they themselves desire, whereas there has surely come to them the Guidance from their Lord!
translations.english_rwwad: These [idols] are no more than names you and your forefathers have made up, for which Allah has not sent down any authority. They follow nothing but conjecture and what their souls desire, although there has come to them guidance from their Lord.

translations.english_saheeh: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or shall man have what he wishes?
translations.english_rwwad: Is it that man can get whatever he wishes for?

translations.english_saheeh: Rather, to Allāh belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
translations.english_hilali_khan: But to Allâh belongs the last (Hereafter) and the first (the world).
translations.english_rwwad: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and this world.

arabic_text: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغۡنِي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن يَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرۡضَىٰٓ
phonetic: 53.26 Wa Kam Min Malakin Fī As-Samāwāti Lā Tughnī Shafā`atuhum Shay'āan 'Illā Min Ba`di 'An Ya'dhana Allāhu Liman Yashā'u Wa Yarđá

translations.english_saheeh: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allāh has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And there are many angels in the heavens, whose intercession will avail nothing except after Allâh has given leave for whom He wills and is pleased with.
translations.english_rwwad: How many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will be of no avail except after Allah’s permission to whom He wills and pleases.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسۡمِيَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ
phonetic: 53.27 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Lā Yu'uminūna Bil-'Ākhirati Layusammūna Al-Malā'ikata Tasmiyata Al-'Unthá

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels female names.

arabic_text: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـٔٗا
phonetic: 53.28 Wa Mā Lahum Bihi Min `Ilmin 'In Yattabi`ūna 'Illā Až-Žanna Wa 'Inna Až-Žanna Lā Yughnī Mina Al-Ĥaqqi Shay'āan

translations.english_saheeh: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and verily, guess is no substitute for the truth.
translations.english_rwwad: They have no knowledge about it. They only follow conjecture, but conjecture is of no avail against the truth.

arabic_text: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ يُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
phonetic: 53.29 Fa'a`riđ `An Man Tawallá `An Dhikrinā Wa Lam Yurid 'Illā Al-Ĥayāata Ad-Dunyā

translations.english_saheeh: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore withdraw (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) from him who turns away from Our Reminder (this Qur’ân) and desires nothing but the life of this world.
translations.english_rwwad: So pay no heed to those who turn away from Our message and who only seek the life of this world.

arabic_text: ذَٰلِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ
phonetic: 53.30 Dhālika Mablaghuhum Mina Al-`Ilmi 'Inna Rabbaka Huwa 'A`lamu Biman Đalla `An Sabīlihi Wa Huwa 'A`lamu Bimani Ahtadá

translations.english_saheeh: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.
translations.english_hilali_khan: That is what they could reach of knowledge. Verily, your Lord it is He Who knows best him who goes astray from His Path, and He knows best him who receives guidance.
translations.english_rwwad: That is the limit of their knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows best who has strayed from His Way, and He knows best who is guided.

arabic_text: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔواْ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى
phonetic: 53.31 Wa Lillahi Mā Fī As-Samāwāti Wa Mā Fī Al-'Arđi Liyajziya Al-Ladhīna 'Asā'ū Bimā `Amilū Wa Yajziya Al-Ladhīna 'Aĥsanū Bil-Ĥusná

translations.english_saheeh: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And to Allâh belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, that He may requite those who do evil with that which they have done (i.e. punish them in Hell), and reward those who do good, with what is best (i.e. Paradise).
translations.english_rwwad: To Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth, so that He may recompense the evildoers for what they did, and reward those who do good with the best reward,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةٞ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓاْ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
phonetic: 53.32 Al-Ladhīna Yajtanibūna Kabā'ira Al-'Ithmi Wa Al-Fawāĥisha 'Illā Al-Lamama 'Inna Rabbaka Wāsi`u Al-Maghfirati Huwa 'A`lamu Bikum 'Idh 'Ansha'akum Mina Al-'Arđi Wa 'Idh 'Antum 'Ajinnatun Fī Buţūni 'Ummahātikum Falā Tuzakkū 'Anfusakum Huwa 'A`lamu Bimani Attaqá

translations.english_saheeh: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
translations.english_hilali_khan: and Al-Fawâhish (illegal sexual intercourse) except the small faults, - verily, your Lord is of Vast Forgiveness. He knows you well when He created you from the earth (Adam), and when you were fetuses in your mothers’ wombs. So ascribe not purity to yourselves. He knows best him who fears Allâh and keeps his duty to Him [i.e. those who are Al-Muttaqûn (the pious. See V.2:2)].
translations.english_rwwad: those who avoid major sins and shameful acts, except for minor lapses. Indeed, your Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you best, as He created you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim purity for yourselves, for He knows best who is truly righteous.

translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen the one who turned away
translations.english_hilali_khan: Did you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) observe him who turned away (from Islâm).
translations.english_rwwad: Have you seen the one who turned away [from Islam],

translations.english_saheeh: And gave a little and [then] refrained?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And gave a little, then stopped (giving)?
translations.english_rwwad: who gave a little, and then stopped?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1571]- Knows that his provision will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has promised otherwise.

translations.english_saheeh: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?[1571]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is with him the knowledge of the Unseen so that he sees?
translations.english_rwwad: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he has insight?

arabic_text: أَمۡ لَمۡ يُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
phonetic: 53.36 'Am Lam Yunabba' Bimā Fī Şuĥufi Mūsá

translations.english_saheeh: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses
translations.english_hilali_khan: Or is he not informed with what is in the Pages (Scripture) of Mûsâ (Moses),
translations.english_rwwad: Or has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of Moses,

translations.english_saheeh: And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) who fulfilled (or conveyed) all that (Allâh ordered him to do or convey):
translations.english_rwwad: and of Abraham, who fulfilled his duty?

translations.english_saheeh: That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another
translations.english_hilali_khan: That no burdened person (with sins) shall bear the burden (sins) of another.
translations.english_rwwad: That no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another,

arabic_text: وَأَن لَّيۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.53:39) Narrated Abû Hurairah رضي الله عنه Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم said: "When a person is dead, his deeds cease (are stopped) except from three:
a) Deeds of continuous Sadaqah (act of charity): e.g. an orphan home (orphanage) or a well for giving water to drink, etc.
b) (Written) knowledge with which mankind gets benefit.
c) A righteous, pious son (or daughter) who begs Allâh to forgive his (or her) parents."
(Sahih Muslim. The Book of Wasâyâ (Wills and Testaments).

translations.english_saheeh: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that man can have nothing but what he does (good or bad).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: and that man will not receive except what he strives for,

translations.english_saheeh: And that his effort is going to be seen -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that his deeds will be seen.
translations.english_rwwad: and that his efforts will be examined,

translations.english_saheeh: Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then he will be recompensed with a full and the best recompense.[2]
translations.english_rwwad: then he will be recompensed in full,

translations.english_saheeh: And that to your Lord is the finality
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that to your Lord (Allâh) is the End (Return of everything).
translations.english_rwwad: and that to your Lord is the final return,

translations.english_saheeh: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that it is He (Allâh) Who makes (whom He wills) laugh, and makes (whom He wills) weep.
translations.english_rwwad: and that He is the One Who makes people laugh and weep,

translations.english_saheeh: And that it is He who causes death and gives life
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that it is He (Allâh) Who causes death and gives life.
translations.english_rwwad: and that He is the One Who causes death and gives life,

phonetic: 53.45 Wa 'Annahu Khalaqa Az-Zawjayni Adh-Dhakara Wa Al-'Unthá

translations.english_saheeh: And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that He (Allâh) creates the pairs, male and female,
translations.english_rwwad: and that He created the pairs, male and female,

translations.english_saheeh: From a sperm-drop when it is emitted
translations.english_hilali_khan: From Nutfah (drops of semen - male and female discharges) when it is emitted.
translations.english_rwwad: from an emitted drop of sperm,

translations.english_saheeh: And that [incumbent] upon Him is the other [i.e., next] creation.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that upon Him (Allâh) is another bringing forth (Resurrection).
translations.english_rwwad: and it is upon Him to bring about the second creation.

translations.english_saheeh: And that it is He who enriches and suffices
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that it is He (Allâh) Who gives much or a little (of wealth and contentment)
translations.english_rwwad: And He is the One Who enriches and bestows wealth,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1572]- A star worshipped by some of the pagan Arabs.

translations.english_saheeh: And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius[1572].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that He (Allâh) is the Lord of Sirius (the star which the pagan Arabs used to worship).
translations.english_rwwad: and that He is the Lord of Sirius [a star worshiped before Islam].

translations.english_saheeh: And that He destroyed the first [people of] ʿAad.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that it is He (Allâh) Who destroyed the former ‘Âd (people),
translations.english_rwwad: And that He destroyed the earlier ‘Ād [people of Hūd],

translations.english_saheeh: And Thamūd - and He did not spare [them] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Thamûd (people): He spared none of them.
translations.english_rwwad: and Thamūd [people of Sālih], sparing none,

arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ
phonetic: 53.52 Wa Qawma Nūĥin Min Qablu 'Innahum Kānū Hum 'Ažlama Wa 'Aţghá

translations.english_saheeh: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the people of Nûh (Noah) aforetime. Verily, they were more unjust and more rebellious and transgressing [in disobeying Allâh and His Messenger Nûh (Noah) عليه السلام].
translations.english_rwwad: and [He destroyed] the people of Noah before them; they were indeed more wicked and more rebellious.

translations.english_saheeh: And the overturned towns[1573] He hurled down.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And He destroyed the overthrown cities [of Sodom to which Prophet Lût (Lot) was sent].
translations.english_rwwad: And He toppled the cities [of Sodom and Gomorrah] upside down,

translations.english_saheeh: And covered them by that which He covered.[1574]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So there covered them that which did cover (i.e. torment with stones).
translations.english_rwwad: and they were utterly covered [by stones].

translations.english_saheeh: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then which of the Graces of your Lord (O man!) will you doubt?
translations.english_rwwad: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?

translations.english_saheeh: This [Prophet (ﷺ)] is a warner from [i.e., like] the former warners.
translations.english_hilali_khan: This (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is a warner (Messenger) of the (series of) warners (Messengers) of old.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: This [Prophet] is a warner like the earlier warners.

translations.english_saheeh: The Approaching Day has approached.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day of Resurrection draws near.
translations.english_rwwad: The imminent Hour has drawn near,

arabic_text: لَيۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
phonetic: 53.58 Laysa Lahā Min Dūni Allāhi Kāshifahun

translations.english_saheeh: Of it, [from those] besides Allāh, there is no remover.
translations.english_hilali_khan: None besides Allâh can avert it (or advance it or delay it).
translations.english_rwwad: none but Allah can disclose it.

translations.english_saheeh: Then at this statement do you wonder?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do you then wonder at this recitation (the Qur’ân)?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you find this discourse astonishing,

translations.english_saheeh: And you laugh and do not weep
translations.english_hilali_khan: And you laugh at it and weep not,
translations.english_rwwad: and you laugh [at it] and not weep,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1575]- Additional meanings are "singing [with expanded chest]," "heedless," or "lost in vain amusements."

translations.english_saheeh: While you are proudly sporting?[1575]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Wasting your (precious) lifetime in pastime and amusements (singing, etc.).
translations.english_rwwad: while persisting in heedlessness?

translations.english_saheeh: So prostrate to Allāh and worship [Him].
translations.english_hilali_khan: So fall you down in prostration to Allâh and worship Him (Alone).
translations.english_rwwad: So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].
